Question:
Octal-RAM and DDR3L/DDR4 can be used as external RAM.
On what basis should I use Octal-RAM and DDR3L/DDR4 properly?
Answer:
Octal-RAM can be connected to RZ/A3UL with fewer pins and a lower frequency than DDR memory.
As a result, the printed circuit board can be made smaller, and the number of passive components required to ensure high-speed signal quality is reduced, which is effective in reducing the cost of the entire system.
On the other hand, DDR3L/DDR4-DRAM memory has several times the bus bandwidth of Octal-RAM, allowing faster Read/Write, and it is possible to choose a memory with a larger capacity than Octal-RAM. We recommend using DDR memory if performance is a priority.
Suitable Products
RZ/A3UL
